title: Hey Riot, if you're doing changes to Lux, why not give her E the Gragas Q treatment?
body:
[](https://cdna.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/008/993/934/large/crow-god-lux-detail-01.jpg?1516544971)
I don't main Lux or even play her really, but I figured I'd try throwing out my 2 cents seeing there being work done on her kit on PBE right now and see what comes from it

It's a generally unhealthy ability in her kit ( [as brought up by Repertoir](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/V76c12Tj-riotrepertoir-i-believe-you-are-buffing-lux-in-the-wrong-place?show=flat&comment=001e) here) , making it a difficult thing to balance, and which I believe a good part of this is caused by the change it got where it can be activated instantly as it lands back in season 5 if I recall correctly

Causing it to have the very high limitations/costs to use it, like the mana cost on it being higher than her ult's mana cost of 100, just at it's level 4 rank at a whopping 115 mana

So why not take advantage of that, change it, thereby allevitating some of those counter play lacking issues by making it like Gragas' Q and make the increased damage rewarded by landing her stun on someone?

Let me go in a bit of detail to explain -

By lowering it's initial starting damage by a fair amount (say... 30~40%) for instant casts, that would at least give it more counter-play and allow them to lower it's mana cost a bit or something due to that

_Then_ for those who let it wait 2 seconds (which is how long her Q snare lasts, you can see where I'm going with this), can then allow it the same damage as it does currently on the live client (or maybe even slightly more), thereby rewarding people for landing their Q on someone **and** giving it more synergy with her kit

___

bonus addition explanation edit seeing conversations so far -

This would also solve her issue with her subpar waveclear, because a focused minion damage increase can also be added to this waiting damage increase mechanic
___

Again as a disclaimer - I'm not a Lux main or play her all too much really, but I'm just throwing this idea out to help in fixing up her kit as Riot is currently experimenting on PBE

So that's all I got to chip in and hope this helps in some sort of way

I'm with you
My biggest annoyance with that is calling charms a taunt.
i mean..they legit aren't any different.

Taunt's force the target to auto attack, charms don't. Taunts make the target follow the attacker around for the duration, charm's cause the target to walk in a straight line from the direction they were hit from.

There's probably more. The point is there are different names for different things for a reason.
Charm actually does force movement towards the caster, not the location of cast. Just play Rakan and try it out.

Direction they we're hit from is not the same as the direction the spell was cast from. Anyway, the point of the distinction I was making was more that the target does not continuously change direction to follow around the caster the way rammus taunt does.
No. They do.
interesting, good point.
that second part sounds false, i can charm as rakan and the enemy will change direction

Yes, they will turn towards the location their hitbox was struck from and walk in that direction. As far as I know though, they will not continue to change directions to keep following the caster the way a rammus taunt would effect them. They just turn to face where rakan was when he struck them and start walking in a straight line.

I think this is a relic from Ahri's release. When Ahri was released, as well as the first charm, the new form of cc was described as a taunt that was slightly different from a normal taunt. On top of that the visual thing that would come up called it a taunt at the time.

The thing is (as both M7 Gragas and Lux) {{champion:79}} has 2 CC allowing him to fully use his Q (E+R, and yes even if it looks "awesome", the flash Q+Flash+E+R+Q combo is really easy to do). Lux's only ability allowing her to use her E fully charged in this case would be her Q, and since she's supposed to poke, reducing the damage if not charged is a bad idea
Her q is also stupidly easy to dodge, so she would pretty much never get to use that for her e.

Most Lux mains use her E first, because it is almost impossible to miss. With the slow from her E, it is now easier to land the Q. So it's E, Auto+Q, Ult+auto. That's a full damage rotation to get the most from her passive. Add in a W+auto at the end or the beginning if you have Lich Bane

So making a change that encourages Q before E seems a bit wrong, especially if players want their passive damage procs. Not disagreeing with you, just clarifying for people who may read

If you have to run around as a Lux while battling someone waiting for your E to charge it doesn't make a lot of sense.  Hitting a charged E is supposed to be a risk vs reward, not something you do in every fight.

All poke champions have a main ability that is a reliable form of poke to be their main damage source.  Ziggs Q, Velkoz W (some people max Q, but W gives two charges and is your wave clear), Taliyah Q, Xerath Q, Lissandra Q, etc etc.  Also, the majority of poke on all the champs is on Q just to make it easy lol.
